body: @mehmetsalgar Thank you for reporting this -- it looks like oversight, and I am not sure why it happened.

If it would be my implementation I have no problem with it, if it would be code that is developed from me, but as I said it is a code from Spring Hateoas Project (http://projects.spring.io/spring-hateoas/) and I have no control over it.

If you make this change, it would take too much time for them to adapt this (possibly other libraries also), the error they were reporting was nothing to do with change and it took me lots of debugging time to figure out what is going wrong.

@mehmetsalgar I think that is actually a problem in that library: could you at least report an issue for them? I am not planning to release new jackson 2.9.x patch any time soon, so fix from Jackson side will not be immediate either, if it is added.

Sure I can report there but lots of other libraries will have problems if they are implemented with the old null check.....

At the moment, it is not an urgent problem for me, I dropped back from Spring Boot 2.0.0.M2 to 1.5.6 and my problem is solved. I just like to give here a pre-warning about what is about to come.

@mehmetsalgar I appreciate your help here.

@sdeleuze WDYT? I can do changes for Jackson 2.9.2 as necessary, but would also like to see if things could be fixed on Spring side if you know who to contact? It should be very small change using existing API.
I will have a deeper look Monday first thing cc @gregturn @olivergierke.
Thanks! No hurry from my side unless something turns up (since 2.9.1 just went out). But don't want to wait until trouble if such exists =)
